data.title: 183 Exquisitely Exotic Girl Names (With Meanings)
data.meta_description: Looking for exotic baby girl names to take you back to feelings of wanderlust and connect with your heritage? Check out our ultimate list!
data.text:
Got that feeling of wanderlust, looking for exotic baby girl names to remind you of sun, sea, and sand?

Your babyâ€™s name can take you back to far-off adventures, sunset beach walks, and unforgettable experiences in foreign lands.

So how about browsing our exotic girl names to find one that takes you back or connects to your heritage?

The word â€˜exoticâ€™ has two meanings â€“ â€œfrom another countryâ€ and â€œdifferent or unusualâ€.

A quick note on cultural appropriation: acknowledging and respecting other cultures is a key part of our values here at Peanut.

If youâ€™re keen to use a name from a culture that doesnâ€™t reflect your identity or heritage, that could be construed as cultural appropriation.

Cultural appropriation can be damaging to many groups of people, so if youâ€™re unsure whether choosing an â€˜exoticâ€™ name is cultural appropriation, you can always reach out to someone from that cultural group to learn more and ask them how they feel about it.

In this article: ğŸ“

What are edgy exotic girl names?

Looking for something fierce, wild, and all-around badass for your baby girl while keeping an exotic feel?

Weâ€™ve put together the best exotic girl names with badass meanings for you:

Almeda: For the hardest-working little peanut, Almeda is a Latin exotic girl name for â€œambitiousâ€.

Elmina: For the willful warrior, Elmina is one of the more exotic girl names meaning â€œhelmetâ€ or â€œprotectionâ€ in German.

Jabari: A musical-sounding but still one of the most badass exotic female names weâ€™ve heard, meaning â€œbraveâ€ in Swahili.

Kai: One of the shorter exotic baby girl names, Kai means â€œwarriorâ€ in Old German, as well as â€œseaâ€ in Hawaiâ€™ian.

Limbani: Looking for exotic names for girls to remind your little peanut of her inner strength? Limbani means â€œbe strongâ€, from the Chewa people of Africa.

Lyra: One of the exotic girl names thatâ€™s jumped up the baby name charts recently, due to the heroine Lyra in Philip Pullmanâ€™s His Dark Materials trilogy, now a TV series. Lyra also means â€œlyre of Orpheusâ€ in Greek, and is the name of a constellation.

Medora: How about Greek exotic girlâ€™s names? For the baby girl who you know will rule over everyone! Medora means â€œrulerâ€ in Greek. Can be shortened to Dora.

Sasha: What better fierce exotic name for your baby girl than Sasha, meaning â€œdefenderâ€ and also the alter-ego of BeyoncÃ© â€“ Sasha Fierce.

Serilda: A truly badass exotic girlâ€™s name, from the German word for â€œbattle armorâ€. Can be shortened to Rilda.

Valentina: Romantic and strong, Valentina is one of the most exotic girlâ€™s names meaning â€œbraveâ€ and â€œstrongâ€. Val or Tina make sweet nicknames.

What are rare exotic female names?

A lot of exotic girl names are already rare, depending on where you are in the world.

If you want something truly unique and exotic, check out this selection of exotic baby girl names that arenâ€™t often found in the baby name charts:

Aiya: (ah-yah) One of the sweetest exotic girlâ€™s names, Aiya is a Hebrew name meaning â€œbirdâ€.

Bastina: Keen on cats? How about naming your little peanut after the Egyptian goddess of cats, sun, and fertility, Bast?

Braulia: A name that was popular but has since become one of the rarest exotic girl names in the world, meaning â€œbrightâ€ or â€œradiantâ€ in Spanish. Can be shortened to Lia.

Daija: (dai-ha) If you want to name your baby in memory of a loved one, how about Daija, meaning â€œremembranceâ€, one of the rarest exotic Spanish girl names?

Gamela: Another of the rare exotic names for girls, Gamela is an Arabic name meaning â€œearnestâ€ or â€œhonestâ€.

Ifeoma: An exotic girlâ€™s name thatâ€™s rarely seen outside of Nigeria, Ifeoma is an Igbo word for â€œfirst-bornâ€.

Jhazala: (jah-zah-lah) One of the rarest Indian exotic baby girl names, Jhazala means â€œgazelleâ€. Can be shortened to Jazz.

Karasi: A musical-sounding exotic girl name meaning â€œlifeâ€ or â€œwisdomâ€, and can be found across Africa, but is very rare outside of the continent.

Manaia: (mah-nye-ah) One of very few MÄori exotic names for girls on our list, Manaia was the name of the MÄori god that travels between our world and the spirit plain.

Mariquita: A name thatâ€™s been lost in time, Mariquita is of Latin origin, meaning â€œstar of the seaâ€.

Pragtige: (pra-h-tih-huh) Looking for something a little different? This is one of the rarest exotic baby girl names â€’ we havenâ€™t found it anywhere else, so your little peanut might be the first! Pragtige is an exotic name meaning â€œbeautifulâ€ in Afrikaans.

Ratana: For the baby girl with a twinkle in her eye, Ratana is a Thai name meaning â€œcrystalâ€.

Sigalit: One of the more uncommon Hebrew exotic girl names that we havenâ€™t seen for a long time â€’ Sigalit means â€œviolet flowerâ€.

Valdis: Looking for gothic exotic names for girls? Valdis could be the one, meaning â€œgoddess of the deadâ€ in Old Norse. Can be shortened to Val.

Zaliki: A beautiful Egyptian exotic girl name meaning â€œnobilityâ€ or â€œwell-bornâ€. Can be shortened to Zali.

What are some exotic girl names?

Exotic girl names evoke images of soft waves lapping against a shore, relaxing in warm sunlight, and feeling the sand between your toesâ€¦

If youâ€™re looking for exotic female names for your little peanut, weâ€™ve got you covered, complete with meanings:

What is the most exotic female name?

For the most exotic names for girls, weâ€™ve gathered those that have entranced multiple cultures â€“ whose roots drift wider than any one border:
